problem.markdown: >>The entire circle shown above represents a total of 2,675 radios sold. Of the following, which is the best approximation of the number of radios represented by the shaded sector of the circle?<< = 275 [explanation] Divide the degrees by the total degrees of a circle and then use that as a percentage of the total.
problem.p: The entire circle shown above represents a total of 2,675 radios sold. Of the following, which is the best approximation of the number of radios represented by the shaded sector of the circle?
